contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox District DE| name=Potsdam-Mittelmark| state=Brandenburg| capital=[[Belzig]]| area=2,575.4|Kreisschlüssel = 12069 | population=204,277| population_as_of=2008-12-31| density=83| carsign=PM| url=[http://www.potsdam-mittelmark.de potsdam-mittelmark.de]| map=brandenburg_pm.png }} '''Potsdam-Mittelmark''' is a ''Kreis'' (district) in the western part of [[Brandenburg]], [[Germany]]. Neighboring are (from the north clockwise) the district [[Havelland]], the district free cities [[Brandenburg (town)|Brandenburg]] and [[Potsdam]], the ''Bundesland'' [[Berlin]], the district [[Teltow-Fläming]], and the districts [[Wittenberg (district)|Wittenberg]], [[Anhalt-Bitterfeld]] and [[Jerichower Land]] in [[Saxony-Anhalt]]. ==Geography== The district includes the southern banks of the [[Havel]] river and the northern parts of the [[Fläming]] (a wooded hill chain). There are three nature parks in the district: [[High Fläming Nature Park]], Nuthe-Nieplitz Nature Park, Westhavelland Nature Park. ==History== The district was created in 1993 by merging the previous districts Belzig, Brandenburg-Land and Potsdam-Land. == Demography == <gallery widths="300" heights="250"> File:Bevölkerungsentwicklung Landkreis Potsdam-Mittelmark.pdf|Development of Population since 1875 within the Actual Boundaries (Blue Line: Population; Dotted Line: Comparison to Population Development of Brandenburg state; Grey Background: Time of Nazi rule; Red Background: Time of Communist rule) File:Bevölkerungsprognosen Landkreis Potsdam-Mittelmark.pdf|Recent Population Development (Blue Line) and Forecasts </gallery> ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top ||[[Image:Wappen Landkreis Potsdam-Mittelmark.png|100px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms is divided into four fields. The left top one shows a red eagle as the symbol of Brandenburg. The three [[oak]]-leaves in the top right both symbolize the prevalent oak forests, but also the three previous districts which were merged to form the current one. In the bottom right are two bishopric keys, which stand for the diocese of Brandenburg. The black-and-golden bars in the bottomleft are the symbol of [[Saxony]], and symbolize that the area around Belzig, Brück, Wiesenburg and Niemegk belonged to Saxony until 1815. |} ==Towns and municipalities== [[Image:Landratsamt Belzig.jpg|thumb|250px|historic district administration building, Belzig]] {| ! width=33% align=left|Amt-free towns ! width=33% align=left|[[Amt (political division)|Ämter]] ! width=33% align=left| |- valign=top || #[[Beelitz]] #[[Belzig]] #[[Teltow]] #[[Treuenbrietzen]] #[[Werder (Havel)]] <br> '''Amt-free municipalities'''<br> #[[Groß Kreutz]] #[[Kleinmachnow]] #[[Kloster Lehnin]] #[[Michendorf]] #[[Nuthetal]] #[[Schwielowsee (municipality)|Schwielowsee]] #[[Seddiner See]] #[[Stahnsdorf]] #[[Wiesenburg]] || '''1.''' [[Beetzsee (Amt)|Beetzsee]] #[[Beetzsee]]<sup>1</sup> #[[Beetzseeheide]] #[[Havelsee]]<sup>2</sup> #[[Päwesin]] #[[Roskow]] '''2.''' [[Brück (Amt)|Brück]] #[[Borkheide]] #[[Borkwalde]] #[[Brück]]<sup>1, 2</sup> #[[Golzow, Potsdam-Mittelmark|Golzow]] #[[Linthe]] #[[Planebruch]] '''3.''' [[Niemegk (Amt)|Niemegk]] #[[Mühlenfließ]] #[[Niemegk]]<sup>1, 2</sup> #[[Planetal]] #[[Rabenstein]] || '''4.''' [[Wusterwitz (Amt)|Wusterwitz]] #[[Bensdorf]] #[[Rosenau, Brandenburg|Rosenau]] #[[Wusterwitz]]<sup>1</sup> '''5.''' [[Ziesar (Amt)|Ziesar]] #[[Buckautal]] #[[Görzke]] #[[Gräben]] #[[Wenzlow]] #[[Wollin, Brandenburg|Wollin]] #[[Ziesar]]<sup>1, 2</sup> |- |colspan=3 align=center|<sup>1</sup>seat of the Amt; <sup>2</sup>town |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat-inline|Landkreis Potsdam-Mittelmark|Potsdam-Mittelmark}} * [http://www.potsdam-mittelmark.de Official website] {{de icon}} {{Germany districts brandenburg}} {{Coord|52|12|N|12|45|E |region:DE-BB_scale:300000_type:adm2nd |display=title}} [[Category:Potsdam-Mittelmark| ]]
